title: 14. Augustus' Building Programme
description: Augustus’ use of monumental architecture and urban renewal to promote stability, tradition, and imperial authority.

questions.question: What was Augustus’ main aim in undertaking a vast building programme in Rome?
options: To create a capital worthy of the Empire

questions.question: How does Suetonius summarise the impact of Augustus’ building programme on Rome?
options: Rome was expanded beyond its walls
Rome was transformed from brick to marble

What temple dominated the Augustan Forum?
How did the Augustan Forum function as propaganda?
options: It presented Augustus as a victorious general and restorer of tradition

questions.question: What policy did Augustus follow when restoring older buildings?
options: He added his own name prominently
He left the original builders’ names intact
He sold them to private citizens

questions.question: Which authors record the restoration of Rome’s aqueducts under Augustus?
How did Augustus involve other elites in the building programme?
options: By forcing them to fund projects
By encouraging leading citizens to contribute

questions.question: Which prominent figures carried out major public works alongside Augustus?
What economic effect did the building programme have on Rome’s population?
Why was Augustus careful not to attach his name to restored buildings?
options: To appear respectful of tradition and Republican values

questions.question: How does the building programme link to Augustus’ claim to have restored the Republic?
options: It emphasised continuity with Rome’s past

questions.question: Which phrase best captures Augustus’ own assessment of his building achievements?
